Class MALSyntaxChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • MALSyntaxChecker

  • public class MALSyntaxChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility class that deals with checking MAL code for errors. These errors include
  • ill-formed label - the first token ends in a colon but doesn't follow the rules for a label name
  • invalid opcode - the first non-comment string (token) found on a line is not one of the valid opcodes; exception: if the line of code contains a label then the opcode should be the second string
  • too many operands - for the specific opcode, there are more operands than expected. Assume that any operands on the line are in a valid, comma-separated list
  • too few operands - for the specific opcode, there are fewer operands than expected. Assume that any operands on the line are in a valid, comma-separated list
  • ill-formed operands - an operand name (id or register) is invalid, an immediate value is invalid for octal
  • wrong operand type - number where id expected, or vice versa
  • label problems - a branch goes to a non-existent label, or there is a label that is never branched to
Version:
1.0
Author:
Trever Mock

    • Method Detail

      • illFormedLabel

        public static java.lang.String illFormedLabel(java.lang.String line)
        Checks for an ill-formed label, that is the first token ends in a colon but doesn't follow the rules for a label name.

        RULES FOR A LABEL NAME:

      • terminated by a colon
      • composed of letters only
      • max length of 5 letters
Parameters:
line - - the line to check the syntax for
Returns:
a string description of the error found. Returns an empty string if no error.

  • invalidOpcode

    public static java.lang.String invalidOpcode(java.lang.String line)
    Checks for an invalid opcode, that is the first non-comment string (token) found on a line is not one of the valid opcodes; exception: if the line contains a label, the the opcode should be the second string.

    VALID OPCODES:

  • MOVEI
  • MOVE
  • ADD
  • INC
  • BGT
  • BR
  • SUB
  • MUL
  • DIV
  • DEC
  • BEQ
  • BLT

    PSUEDO OPCODES:

  • END
    Parameters:
    line - - the line to check the syntax for
    Returns:
    a string description of the error found. Returns an empty string if no error.

  • illFormedOperands

    public static java.lang.String illFormedOperands(java.lang.String line)
    Checks for ill formed operands, that is an operand name (id or register) that is invalid or an immediate value is invalid for octal.
    Parameters:
    line - - the line to check the syntax for
    Returns:
    a string description of the error found. Returns an empty string if no error.

  • invalidOperands

    public static java.lang.String invalidOperands(java.lang.String line)
    Checks for an invalid operand type, for example a number where an id is expected; or vice versa.

    Also checks for if there are too many or too few operands for the opcode in the line.

    Parameters:
    line - - the line to check the syntax for
    Returns:
    a string description of the error found. Returns an empty string if no error.

  • labelProblems

    public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> labelProblems(java.lang.String fullText)
    Checks for label problems, that is if a branch goes to a non-existent label, or there is a label that is never branched to.
    Parameters:
    fullText - - the full text in the form of a string on one line with the token '**n**' in areas where a new line would have been in the code.
    Returns:
    a list of string descriptions of any errors or warnings found. Returns an empty ArrayList if no errors or warnings are found.

  • endProblems

    public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> endProblems(java.lang.String fullText)
    Checks for any problems with the END instruction.
  • The END instruction should appear exactly once
  • The END instruction should be the last instruction in the MAL code
    Parameters:
    fullText - - a String of text representing the entire MAL program on one line with ';' separating new lines.
    Returns:
    - A String list of any errors found involving the END instruction. Returns an empty list if no errors are found

  • getIdentifiers

    public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getIdentifiers(java.lang.String line)
    Gets the identifiers in a given line of MAL code and returns them in the form of an ArrayList
    Parameters:
    line - - the line to be examined
    Returns:
    the identifiers that the line of MAL code contains. Returns an empty list if the line contains no identifiers.
